title: Mount Targon, and why thus far it does nothing.
body:
Negative title, I know, and one that has probably had countless similar posts created however I will say that I have held no real attachment to any of the characters involved beyond a mild dislike of Diana.

"So why would you have any issues with the new lore if you don't really care for the characters" You may be asking, well it's rather simple actually. These events have had a lot of changes with the lore, some good, some bad. I don't consider myself a good writer by any means, but I do dabble in it as a hobby, and one of the very important aspects of writing is character development (or lack there of, look at Inigo Montoya from the Princess Bride). Notice the key word there, development, as in a change over time, this was something that was showcased extremely well with the Bilgewater event, with TF and Graves coming to terms with their past and not murdering each other, GP and MF having a real solid reason to be fighting beyond maybe GP killing her mother, but that never truly being confirmed.

Go back to the Freljord event and we have some serious concerns with a full blown retcon of lores, from minor things like Udyr being solidly placed, or Gragas being on his quest for the perfect drink instead of just being around and sometimes getting drunk and fighting people. Then we have Trundle. For anyone who doesn't remember his original lore, he was basically an outcast who received the disease of his entire tribe in the hopes that he would be accepted, only to be tossed in the muck and despised even more. His connection to the League was one of pure spite, with him opting to keep the disease knowing full well that his entire tribe would die without it. It was a little shaky, sure, but it was still good, it made him unique. Now he's just a big guy with a large weapon who takes himself way too seriously, sound familiar? {{champion:122}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:23}} 

My issue here is that yeah, Pantheon and Leona for sure had some outdated lore. It was only sort of half there in a way, but it gave them a purpose, and a good one at that. They retconned the League itself, and now they're taking all the champions with ties to it and making the character be as far from it as possible. They're slowly tearing apart everything the game is based on and creating something else. Sure, the writing is good now, it's a lot more solid, they have somebody who did I think Warhammer 40K, so yeah, the quality of the writing itself has definitely gone up, but what bothers me isn't that the writing is bad. What bothers me is that the writing doesn't have character development, it doesn't have them changing over time, or finding a new purpose, it's just destroying them and putting someone else in their skin (literally for Pantheon). The Mount Targon change doesn't advance the story in any way, it doesn't really change anything about the game, or necessarily about the world as a whole, it's a waste of writing and potential for the sake of having something to do. Recreating old characters with nothing but lore changes and complete rewrites doesn't do anything but make the loyal players dislike you.

Who is going to be next on the rewrite chopping block? They've hit the entirety of the Freljord already, a decent chunk of Ionia, Demacia is in a constant state of nobody knowing really what they're doing, so they just shout the name of their homeland instead. The sad thing is that the interesting characters are all the ones being retconned to oblivion. Trundle was pretty interesting, now he's just menacing big guy #8. Leona is now Pantheon's old personality, Pantheon is basically exactly the same except now he hates Leona along with everyone else, Diana is now buddy buddy with the Solari? Like OK, probably going to be some huge event involving another faction, but why rewrite the characters entirely instead of just having them overcome their differences to deal with a more dangerous threat? 

I guess at the end of the day I just don't get it, what is the actual point here Riot? I know you have a new writer, but he isn't new to writing, have him build on what is already here, don't have him just scrap it all for something else. 

I guess I'll quit nagging now, and sorry if this was all a waste of time for you. Sincerely, someone who actually liked Runeterra the way it was years ago as flawed as it may have been.

replies.body:
I think you are being a little unfair, it isn't like these new lore pieces is an event like the Bilgewater one. The Bios and Color text is just character set up for when they do get into an event.

They most likely have a planned direction for where they want there characters to go and in my opinion these "new" characters are much better than the one note cookie cutter characters from the past.

Edit: Trundle is an exception though, but his story was completed and sapped of potential, so I can see why they changed him.

With the elaborate page setup and focus on it I highly doubt it's just a one-off "because we can" kind of thing, but thus far retconning everything so far means absolutely nothing beyond them deciding that completely rewriting a character is easier than keeping what personality is already there and having the characters simply grow as characters. It's a lazy way of setting things up for the short term instead of evolving the story over time to be what they want it to be in the end either way, creating more information and more character attachment in the process.

Sure it seems rather harsh, but keep in mind the only lore changes that have happened recently are these large events or red posts invalidating previously known things, most of which is just a lot of retcon, and very little character development.
It is hard to build something when the foundation isn't solid to begin with{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Who wouldn't love to build a story with a demi-god warrior who exists entirely to defend his homeland and whose personality has literally been obliterated?

Just think of all the character progression that can stem from a character who no longer exists!

Seriously, the first thing people will do to add depth to this character is either ignore the fact that his body is now being used by some celestial force or cause him to have slow resurgences of that old personality. When the first move is to contradict the prior story something might have been wrong.

Ah but this is fiction, not building a house. Not to mention that the new writer they have hired is very well known for being a good writer.

That aside, yes, you do have a good point, working to create something from nothing is nigh impossible, however there isn't just nothing to work with.

Off topic, but Diana's lore actually holds mostly true to her original.

I agree though, we're not getting much through just retconning everything.

Yeah, I vaguely remember her lore (as I said, didn't really like her even before her official release), only read through it once and it seems mostly intact, but she now seems really depressive and such in game despite her now wanting to help out the Solari who are just like "lol no, Heretic". 

I just wish that instead of gutting entire characters and revisiting the invasion of the body snatchers they could just, heaven forbid, change their way of thinking for whatever reason for a new plot direction.

This is the big issue with League lore, at the moment. They still haven't recovered from the Great Retcon, so now they need to retcon more stuff to fit in, but that takes time and money that could be spent on new stories and puts it to work writing new origin stories.

It's like if they rebooted the Marvel Cinematic Universe and had to re-make every single origin movie. Sure, the individual movies might be good, but it's all either stuff we've heard before or changing something that we liked for (as far as we can tell) no reason.

Yeah, I kind of hate how Riot at this point has pretty much just said "piss off" to the entire original narrative and instead of redoing it all at once they just occasionally peel off another bandage over the course of a couple of years expecting people to be super happy with it and "ooh" and "ahh" at all the fancy graphics like nothing has been done.

Like the new writing is REALLY good, the writers are doing a good job, but the job that they are doing feels like the wrong choice and they're just plowing ahead with it anyway. Nothing is really changing except the quality of the writing so far and it annoys me to no end that nothing is really happening most of the time, and then stuff like the Bilgewater event comes along and changes a ton of stuff in like a week, then it's back to nothing for months at a time.

It seems this is more about you disliking the retcon then anything Mt. Targon related. The retcon will always remain controversial, most people were fine how the old lore was handled with Summoners and JoJ and League Judgements. However, If you look at the work this new lore team did with the new lore, The Bilgewater and Harrowing event, i think it is fair to say that the quality of lore has increased from the old days.

Now for the Mt. Targon itself, this is just the prologue to a more complete story, it only contains backstory and introductions for the main players for the event. When the real event starts, all sort of things could happen that will advance the story, maybe Atreus manages to take back control from Pantheon, maybe Leona and Diana become friends, put in there the chance of an Void invasion, plus Taric and new champs roles to play, all sort of things are possible.

Now, could have this all been done within the old lore? Probably. But if they felt the retcon was so much needed for them to write all of this great material, I think its a good trade.

It's a mix of me disliking retcon as a means of advancement and that thus far (as the title suggests) it doesn't really mean anything at all, it's just sort of there to be there, in other words it (so far, again) is pointless. It's a lot of pretty page design, and a lot of filler at this point in time. Is there more to come? The rather obvious answer is yes, they didn't have the extra spaces by accident, but until those spaces are filled and we can see the full picture what has been presented means essentially nothing beyond Riot sort of giving up on their previous designs.

It's also not so much that the previous lore was simply so awful it needed to be changed, retconning feels more like the lazy solution to a narrative problem, I have a good bit of experience with retcons having played a lot of D&D (yeah yeah, I'm that nerd) and usually retcons are just used as a way to say "I don't feel like fixing this over time, so we'll just pretend that it didn't happen that way".

It's only been up for a day and there are two slots left.

One will be Aurelion Sol

and the other might be Taric.

We are not giving it time to give us the next segment in the Mt. Targon Update.

{{champion:54}} 

I'm honestly not convinced Aurelion Sol will be part of the Targon update.

This actually makes decent sense, Aurelion Sol was re-teased too recently for me to feel confident that he'll be added in with this event, but by the same token isn't Malphite's thing that he's from another dimension made of sentient rocks? If they were to change that I'd be slightly disappointed because it is a pretty interesting backstory. Sure he could just join up with the Targon crew, but it'll take some convincing as to why he would beyond "there's a big rock there".

While I think that Malphite will eventually be added to the Targon roster,I think it is possible that they'll look at him later on.

You know like Fizz and Nautilus who are known to be bilgewater champions,but had no effect on the bilgewater event,or Elise who is from the shadow isles,but wasn't involved in last years harrowing(yorick and eve were likely left out because of their reworks)

This is not an overall review of the Mount Targon update since, rather obviously, we don't have the whole update. With the information we have at this point in time, it means absolutely nothing beyond Riot giving up on old characters' design philosophy. Right now it's just lots of filler and pretty graphic design.

Is there more to come? Yes. Will I like what comes next? Rather likely that yes, I will. Do I like what is here at the moment? Not nearly as much as I would if they had simply advanced the characters rather than scrapping them and rewriting someone else into them.

This isn't an issue of the Mount Targon changes being bad across the board sine half the board is still covered up, merely my reaction and thoughts towards what we have seen so far, hence why the title wasn't "The Mount Targon changes are awful, wtf Rito".
